plan: 1. Low-bid strategy: Place low bids (20-30% of my value) to determine minimum required to win. 2. Aggressive strategy: Place high bids (80-90% of my value) to maximize win chances and likely learn opponent patterns. 3. Incremental bids: Start with moderate bids (40-60% of my value) and adjust incrementally based on opponents' bids history. 4. Randomized strategy: Place bids randomly within the range (0-99) to gather data on opponents' bidding behaviors and detect patterns. Rotate these strategies and analyze results to adapt for maximizing long-term profit.

1. Start with conservative bids, close to my own value but slightly lower, to establish a baseline for how aggressively others are bidding. 2. Incrementally increase my bids to observe at what value I start winning consistently. 3. Test a few aggressive bids, slightly above my own value, to see if higher bidding translates to higher wins. 4. Occasionally place low bids, regardless of my value, to gather data on other bidders' patterns and potential overbids. 5. Analyze the history data to adjust my strategies dynamically, focusing on the balance between winning frequency and maximizing profit margin.

To maximize profit, I will explore three bidding strategies: 1) Bid half of my value to assess conservative gains. 2) Bid close to my value when my value is high (e.g., above $70) to ensure competitive offers. 3) Bid aggressively ($99) when my value is near $99 to dominate the auction. I will track historical outcomes to adjust strategies dynamically. Winning with minimal overbids and understanding opponents' bidding patterns will be key. Each strategy will be tested across several rounds for robust data gathering and fine-tuning.
